website_summaries.verdict: Immensely comfortable—this is what trail adventurers would likely say once they slip into the ultra-plush confines of the Arrowood Riva Waterproof. The shoe’s excellence, however, is not just all about loads of comfort—it is also about incredible waterproofing, durability, and style. Unfortunately, this sizing-consistent footgear might be a little too challenging to keep laced up. All in all, the Teva Arrowood Riva Waterproof simply has a lot of amazing qualities that even those unsure about its unruly laces would be hard-pressed to ignore.
pros: Droves of verified purchasers applauded the Teva Arrowood Riva Waterproof’s comfort level
Its remarkable ability to prevent water intrusion stoked numerous wearers
This hiking shoe was considered fantastically durable by many users
The Teva Arrowood Riva WP runs true to size, based on several reports
Some owners adored the shoe’s mesmerizing looks
The hiker’s underfoot support floored a number of customers
About a handful of patrons found their Teva Arrowood Riva WP shoes exceptionally light
On the traction front, this footgear received praises from a few testers
cons: An owner had a tough time keeping the footwear’s laces tied

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, Excellent choice for extensive walking/hiking and adventure travel!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoes! Purchased specifically for a trip to Ecuador where it was forecasted to rain every day. I'm happy to report that for both walking around town (including cobblestone streets) and for serious hiking (Cotopaxi and Cajas) these shoes provided much better support than athletic shoes and were waterproof as advertised. At first, if you're not used to real hiking shoes they don't feel ultra-comfortable like sneakers do but the rigid sole keeps your feet from getting exhausted on days where you do a lot of walking over uneven terrain. I typically walk 8,000 steps/day and during this trip I averaged 17,000 steps/day and my feet were fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Weston

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but not as good as my Ahnus
customer_reviews.text: Teva bought Ahnu and I love Ahnus. I was really hoping this shoe would live up to what I had expected. They fit well and for the most part are comfortable. I wear them as my daily shoe and for walks and short hikes. But they don’t offer the same support and after 6 months and the soles feel mushy. On top of that some of the stitching has given way around the toe box. I’m not overly hard on my shoes and the Ahnus always held up. Sad that Teva still offers some of the Ahnus for women but not men.
customer_reviews.author: M. Buettner

customer_reviews.title: Great for slippery surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes because they don't slip on slippery surfaces and they are mostly waterproof. I work with swimming pools so I have to have these shoes. I buy them over and over again after they wear out. They last me usually about 5-6 months but my job is labor intensive so that's pretty good compared to all the other shoes out there. I highly recommend these to people working around water and slippery surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Birdmonkey

customer_reviews.title: Gret fit and cannot wait to hike in them
customer_reviews.text: I was so discouraged to discover that I could not replace my worn out Ahnu hiking shoes but upon discovering that they were a brand created by Teva I researched and bought these. Just like my Ahnu's they fit like a glove and will need no breaking in. They fee awesome! Haven't hiked yet but know they will be perfect for the trail. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: David Longenecker

customer_reviews.title: TEVA SHOES run small and NARROW
customer_reviews.text: I was promised a 9.5 Wide. What I got was a regular in Walnut. The only way to see if a shoe fits is to test it. Unfortunately if you test it then it’s no longer exchangeable for Amazon and it’s third party sellers. So I am out $150 and a shoe that is indeed too tight. Next time I buy shoes I will go to REI where you have a year to wear shoes an if they don’t work out, you can return them for cash no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: Tatertot

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe if you don't wear a Wide
customer_reviews.text: I owned four pairs of the previous model of this shoe (all in Wide) -- most comfortable shoe I've ever worn. I bought two pairs of the new Arrowood model to try on: all indications are that they are also supremely comfortable, if I wear very thin socks, but are completely unwearable using regular socks due to tightness in the toe box. It appears Teva has decided not to offer a Wide version of the Arrowood, so I had to return both pairs. The search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Ragnar

customer_reviews.title: They don't break in very easy
customer_reviews.text: Overall the fit is a bit large for my foot accept above my right pinky toe area it crushes the top of it and won't seem to break in, it's very stiff. I am going to have to try a shoe stretcher. usually this size Teva fits me perfect so I'm a little bummed.
customer_reviews.author: T Tree

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart...
customer_reviews.text: Right shoe has torn open at the rubber toe cap. This pair is 4 months old. I've been wearing Teva shoes for a long time and this is a first for me. I've been instructed by Teva to return them for evaluation and a possible refund. They will not replace them directly. If found defective the credit can be used to purchase a new pair... If not found defective they will be the last Teva shoes I own.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Poor Construction Not Water Proof
customer_reviews.text: 0 Stars! Lasted less than a few montha and the rubber on the toe box started peeling away and the cloth on the inside has separated from the leather. Now they feel like I’m wearing a baggy sock. All of this and they are NOT even water resistent let alone water proof. Never again Teva! You should be ashamed.
customer_reviews.author: J-Mo

customer_reviews.title: Teva still makes wide shoes that fit.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Teva shoes for work and play for years, but switched to Keen for a heavier-duty work shoe. They used to fit well right out of the box, but Keen has narrowed up their "wide" line of shoes, and I have gone back to Teva as the only shoe that has the width I need. Thank you Teva for sticking with your unique products, and not "value engineering" them to the point where they do not fit me anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Fitzgibbon

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple days to break these Teva hiking shoes in. Once broken in, they are very comfy and cute. I love them. I ordered a men's 9.5 (I wear a women's 12.) The shoes were tight and I sent them back for a 10. Now I wish I had not because, after wearing them for a month, they seem to have stretched out a bit.
customer_reviews.author: LunaC

customer_reviews.title: Fits Comfortably and Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Fits Comfortably and Perfectly. I had the Merrill hiking boots, but when I walk, my toes touch the front. This shoes holds your feet snug inside the shoes. Truly premium quality, both in looks and feel. I already have boots from the same company. They are just as comfortable and premium quality. I recommend these shoes 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah

customer_reviews.title: Will continue to buy forever
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these three years ago from the store and I wore them everyday. They held up so well that I decided to buy another pair and haven’t been disappointed. As long as the quality and comfort doesn’t decline, I’ll continue to buy this exact shoe. I should also note that I use my own insole.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes.
customer_reviews.text: My third pair. Hold up well. We walk 5 days a week about 3 miles on pavement plus the rest of the day. Materials are durable and the foot bed does support pretty well. If I can trust the iPhone step counter I get about a thousand miles out of a pair of these shoes. Going to walk the Camino de Santiago next month and will give it a real test.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stefanick

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than actual size marked
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes, they are holding up great. My only con on them is that they fit to small. I ordered up one half size of what I usually order, but even then they were to small. I went ahead and kept the shoes hoping they would stretch into what would fit me best, unfortunately they did not stretch, I even used a shoe stretcher to no avail. I kept the shoes, cuz they are exactly what I was looking for, and even ordered a new pair, bigger, in preparation for a European trip we are taking this summer. They should be nicely broken in by then.
customer_reviews.author: Memo V.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Quality Broke in 3.5 months of light use
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product, it didn't last 3.5 months of very light use. The shoes looked and felt great. The center nylon string eyelet tore loose, now i have a hole where it attached. Very disappointed. I can't return a useless product that cost $149.99!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommended !
customer_reviews.text: I would absolutely recommend these shoes to anyone who works on their feet, or hikes. A great alternative to a large clunky boot. Very comfortable and tons of support. Teva is the best !
customer_reviews.author: jordan tigershtrom

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Premium materials and feel. Fits true to size and the vibram sole is a great addition to Teva as always. This is my second set of shoes from Teva and they last for years as long as we maintain them!
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: They last more than a year through some pretty heavy use in my general contracting business and have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th or 6th pair of these. They last more than a year through some pretty heavy use in my general contracting business and have enough room for orthotic inserts. They keep my feet dry and well supported.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Teva shoes for over a decade. These are waterproof including the tongue as it is sewn completely into shoe. I usually wear a 12 but order a size 13 or 14. I got this in a 14 so I could use shoe pads for a little extra comfort. My last pair of Teva's lasted over 5 years. These are good high quality all weather shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Levi

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Durable
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of Tevas and every pair has been very comfortable and durable. I like these shoes so much I bought the low-boot version of this shoe as well.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: I just like these shoes comfortable for all occasions. My feet feel great after a long hike or just working in my shop all day
customer_reviews.author: shannon ballard

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for a Guy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit, perfect weight. This is my umpteenth purchase of Teva walking shoes, always fine quality, always lasting. Thanks for the continued quality control!
customer_reviews.author: James Keolker

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes, not quite as comfortable as my previous ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes, not quite as comfortable as my previous 4 year old pair of Teva Arrowoods, but I'm happy with them. There was a small defect in the toe region of one shoe. If I had seen that in a walk in store, I would not have bought them, but its just a cosmetic issue and overall I am very happy with the shoes. I got these for hiking with my dog and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi_Tim

customer_reviews.title: I will buy again!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful shoes! I need to add proprietary insoles to my outdoor shoes for proper support and additional cushioning, which I did and I love these shoes. The old ones, same brand, lasted over 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these Teva's for many years, and this pair did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: pen name

customer_reviews.title: Not bulky, keeps feet dry and warm
customer_reviews.text: I wear 11 men's and ordered 11. They seem to fit fine and will need a few weeks to break in. They feel good when walking and keep the feet dry, your feet will get warm as not so breathable. I am picky with shoes but these will work. A good cool weather shoe that's not too bulky
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A.

customer_reviews.title: An attractive sturdy shoe.
customer_reviews.text: As expected a strong sturdy shoe that looks good in casual situations. Shoe needs a little break-in around the ankle but I am not concerned. Very pleased with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe. Standing and walking all day and my feet don't hurt. Kind of hard to clean though after a trek through the desert.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe and they look nice am happy with them
customer_reviews.author: dbmotors

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit compared to previous model
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with these. I've owned two pairs of the previous model (#4043) and those were the most comfortable shoes I've ever owned. These (same size) bit into my Achilles tendon and were unwearable. At least the return process was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Zippy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love my Teva - my choice of boot for work and play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Teva
customer_reviews.text: I've rated this at 4 stars since I have not worn them that much at this time. I wish they had wide sizes which would make them much more comfortable. I marked them somewhat small but it is really somewhat narrow.
customer_reviews.author: M. KLINE

product_meta.title: Teva Men's Arrowood Riva Wp High Rise Hiking Boots
product_meta.description: -Waterproof-leather upper seals out the elements to keep your feet dry. Event premium waterproof-breathable membrane keeps your feet cool and dry. -Rubberized toe cap provides rugged durability and toe protection. -Responsive PU sockliner cushions the foot and puts a spring in your step. -Float-lite eva-foam midsole with pu high-rebound heel pad for lightweight cushioning. -Durable vibram rubber outsole stands up to the demands of rugged terrain. -Nylon shank stabilizes and supports your foot on uneven terrain. -Half pair weight (oz): 16.0.
feature_bullets: Get ready to reap the benefits of the ruggedly good-looking and durable Teva® Arrowood Riva WP hiking boot.
Waterproof construction helps feet stay dry and protected from outside moisture.
Full-grain waterproof leather and textile uppers.
Rubberized toe cap for added durability and protection.
International products have separate terms, are sold from abroad and may differ from local products, including fit, age ratings, and language of product, labeling or instructions.
